com.aevi.payment

Class PaymentRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.helpers.BundleWrapper
      • com.aevi.payment.AeviRequest
        • com.aevi.payment.FinancialRequest
          • com.aevi.payment.PaymentRequest

  • public class PaymentRequest
extends FinancialRequest
    The PaymentRequest object represents a single payment request made to the Aevi payment application. It contains a purchase amount, and optionally a tipping amount and cash-out amount.

    Creating a PaymentRequest is the first step to making a payment. When constructed, it can be used to obtain an Intent used to launch the payment application. 

     
 PaymentRequest payment = new PaymentRequest(new BigDecimal("10.00"));
 startActivityForResult(payment.createIntent(), 0);

    When the payment application returns control to the caller, the PaymentRequest object that initiated the payment is returned along with a TransactionResult. To obtain the payment request inside the onActivityResult method in your activity, use the fromIntent(Intent) method. 

     
 PaymentRequest result = PaymentRequest.fromIntent(data);
    See Also:
    TransactionResult, PaymentAppConfiguration.isPaymentApiUsable()

    • Method Detail

      • fromIntent

        public static PaymentRequest fromIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
                                 throws AeviRequestDataMissingException
        Gets a PaymentRequest from an Intent. If the Intent does not contain a payment request a AeviRequestDataMissingException exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent to get the payment request object from.
        Returns:
        the PaymentRequest contained within the Intent.
        Throws:
        AeviRequestDataMissingException

      • getTipAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getTipAmount()
        Returns:
        the tipping amount as a BigDecimal

      • setTipAmount

        public PaymentRequest setTipAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Sets the tipping amount. May be set to zero to indicate no tip. Setting the amount to null will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown. A negative amount or an amount with fractional cents will result in an InvalidAmountException being thrown.
        Parameters:
        amount - the tipping amount as a BigDecimal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is null
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount is negative or has fractional cents.

      • getCashOutAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getCashOutAmount()
        Gets the cash-out amount as a BigDecimal
        Returns:
        the cash-out amount as a BigDecimal

      • setCashOutAmount

        public PaymentRequest setCashOutAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Sets the cash out amount. May be set to zero to indicate no cash out. Setting the amount to null will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown. A negative amount or an amount with fractional cents will result in an InvalidAmountException being thrown.
        Parameters:
        amount - the cash out amount as a BigDecimal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is null
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount is negative or has fractional cents.

      • getTotalAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getTotalAmount()
        Computes the total amount to be paid. Calculated as the sum of the (purchase) amount, cash-out amount, and tips.
        Returns:
        total amount to be paid by the customer
